p: A trial was carried out on patients proposed for colonoscopy and divided into two groups. Aromatherapy was performed by inhalation of Sunflower oil (control group) and Neroli oil (experimental group). Results showed that there was no significance difference of procedural anxiety measured by State Trait Anxiety Inventory state (STAI-S) score and procedural pain evaluated by visual analogue scale (VAS), before and after aromatherapy in patients subjected to colonoscopy. Significant lower pre- and postprocedural systolic blood pressure in Neroli group than control group were observed. The authors concluded that the inhalation aromatic agent had an effect on lowering procedural anxiety-related (excessive fear of medical, dental, or surgical procedures that results in acute distress or interference) blood pressure [ 54].
